summary: The National Biotechnology Safety Act authorizes the National Science Foundation (NSF) to fund research on biotechnology risk assessment, focusing on environmental, human, and animal health risks. It directs the NSF to establish a program within its Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships, providing funding through grants, agreements, and consortia. The bill also mandates a two-phase study by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine on the safety and benefits of biotechnology, with reports and an implementation plan to Congress. It authorizes appropriations for the NSF program and the National Academies study.
